channel.title: noob question
channel.description: I just got a g11 logitech keyboard and I am wondering if it is possible to create programs that open programs, like uTorrent. Thanks.

item.title: noob question
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Yeah, if a keyboard has extra keys it should come with some way to program them. I’d like to have one of those keyboards actually. Sorry for not being much help.

np, Ramminator gave me the answer.

I really suggest buying it. When I boot from cd the keys light up and it is beautiful (the keys don’t light up while booting, and other than booting the windows xp cd that is as far as my computer will go), I’d really suggest it. I think all the extra keys are a tad superfluous, especially because it makes the keyboard to long; I have to put my mouse on top of my desk instead of in the keyboard tray.

Read full topic

item.title: noob question

item.title: noob question
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Raminator:

You should have the “Logitech G-series key profiler” in your system tray, and if you don’t, you need to download the Logitech GamePanel software from their site (you can use the same version the G15s use). Open it up, click the G-key you want, click “assign shortcut”, fill in the dialogue box. So simple even a woman could figure it out.

Thanks, I went through all of the above except the assign shortcut part. I didn’t see that option, maybe my driver is old and doesn’t have it, or I just didn’t notice it. Either way, I’ll have to wait to find out because I got to have a computer expert friend of mine take a look at my computer and fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: noob question
item.dc:creator: Spooboy
item.description:
I got the same keyboard. I’m not much help, but I do know that there are websites out on the internet for that particular keyboard and configuration. People that like WOW and other mmorpgs use thoes keys for bindings and other stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: noob question
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Kairouseki:

You might be able to do it with some programming though I have no idea how, sorry. And do you mean F1?

Logitech g11 has extra programmable keys, g1 through g18.

Guf:

If the keyboard comes with extra buttons its driver usually has a config thingy to set what they do, but they are not always as configurable as one would like. Check out what TweakXP has in the way of config for extra keys too.

Yeah, it’s got a config, but I can’t find any way to use the config to set it to open a program. I’ll check tweakxp, except atm I am using my mom’s computer because my computer just got completely fried.

Read full topic
